bibl.title: Reading Papyri, Writing Ancient History. (Approaching the Ancient World.)
bibl.note: Introduction: History and Papyri. - 1. The Culture of Papyrus. - 2. Ancient and Modern Choices in Documentation. - 3. Particular and General. - 4. Time and Place. - 5. Quantification. - 6. Asking Questions. - 7. Continuity and Renewal.
bibl.seg: BAGNALL Roger S., Reading Papyri, Writing Ancient History. (Approaching the Ancient World.)
London - New York, Routledge, 1995, 8°, viii-145 pp. et 8 pll. ISBN 0-415-09376-7 (hbk) / 0-415-09377-5 (pbk). £30 (hbk) / £9.99 (pbk).

Introduction: History and Papyri. - 1. The Culture of Papyrus. - 2. Ancient and Modern Choices in Documentation. - 3. Particular and General. - 4. Time and Place. - 5. Quantification. - 6. Asking Questions. - 7. Continuity and Renewal.

C.R. par Richard Alston, CR N.S., 47 (1997) pp. 172-173. - I.F. Fikhman, SCI 16 (1997) pp. 279-285. - Werner Huss, ChrEg 71 (1996) No. 142, pp. 365-366. - Francesca Lamberti, Labeo 42 (1996) pp. 544-545. - Dominic Rathbone, AJA 101 (1997) pp. 429-430. - Mariachiara Lama, Aegyptus 76 (1996) pp. 195-196. - Günter Poethke, ArchPF 43 (1997) pp. 409-410. - Jean A. Straus, AntCl 66 (1997) pp. 554-555. - Hans Hauben, BibO 55 (1998) coll. 787-792. - Andrea Jördens, Klio 82 (2000) pp. 294-296. - Pasquale Massimo Pinto, QS 27 (2001) No. 53, pp. 259-262.
